man.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: There were two men and a woman in the car.
Don’t keep Hansen waiting – he’s a busy man.
man.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a man who has the qualities that people think a man should have, such as being brave, strong etc
man.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Come on, be a man now. No more crying.
He wasn’t man enough (=strong or brave enough) to face up to his responsibilities.
Running his own business has really made a man out of Terry.
man.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a person, either male or female – used especially in formal situations or in the past
man.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: All men are equal in the eyes of the law.
man.translation[0].definitions[3].note.t: prehistoric/Stone Age/modern man (=people who lived at a particular stage of human development)
man.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: This is one of the worst diseases known to man.
man.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: a man who works for an employer
man.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: Why were there no protests from the men at the factory?
man.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: a man who does a job for you, especially repairing something
man.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: Has the man been to fix the TV?
I waited all day for the gas man.
man.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: a man who works for a particular company or organization
man.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: Was that the man from the PR agency?
man.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: a man who comes from a particular place, does a particular kind of work, or is connected with a particular organization, especially a university or company
man.translation[0].definitions[7].exampl: I think she married a Belfast man.
I’ve been a military man all my life.
Even a Harvard man has a lot to learn about politics.
man.translation[0].definitions[8].defini: a man who likes, or likes doing, a particular thing
man.translation[0].definitions[8].exampl: I’m more of a jazz man myself.
man.translation[0].definitions[9].defini: a soldier or sailor who is under the authority of an officer
man.translation[0].definitions[9].exampl: The captain ordered his men to fire.
man.translation[0].definitions[10].examp: She spent five years waiting for her man to come out of prison.
man.translation[0].definitions[11].examp: My man will drive you to the station.
man.translation[0].definitions[12].defin: one of the pieces you use in a game such as chess
man.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: man
an adult male human
a young man
Sir Edmund Hillary was the first man to climb Mount Everest.
guy
She’d arranged to meet a guy in the bar.
Alex is a really nice bloke.
gentleman
a man – used as a very polite way of talking about a man
an elderly gentleman
Please could you serve this gentleman?
boy
a young male person, usually a child or a teenager
a teenage boy
lad
a boy or young man
When I was a young lad, I wanted to join the army.
youth
a teenage boy or young man – used especially in news reports to show disapproval
Gangs of youths roam the streets.
a man – used especially by the police or in science and research contexts. The adjective male  is much more common than the noun
We are investigating the death of an unidentified male.
The condition is usually found only in males.
dude
a man – a very informal use
You could tell there was something creepy going on with that dude.
relating to men
a male teacher, singer etc is a man. Male jobs are the kind of jobs that men typically do
Most science teachers are male.
a male nurse
We are trying to recruit more women to do traditionally male jobs such as engineering.
masculine
considered to be more typical of a man than of a woman
He had a very masculine face.
masculine aggression
manly
having the qualities that people expect and admire in a man, such as being brave and strong
He took off his shirt, revealing his manly chest.
It isn’t considered manly to cry.
In the portrait, the King looked manly and in control.
He was bronzed and athletic, with manly features and a steady gaze.
macho
behaving in a way that is traditionally typical of men, for example by being strong and tough and not showing your feelings – used especially either humorously or to show disapproval
On the outside he may seem to be very macho but inside he’s very sensitive.
Stallone always plays macho men.
He’s far too macho to drink mineral water.
man.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: used when speaking to an adult male, especially when you are excited, angry etc
man.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: used when speaking to someone, especially an adult male
man.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: to work at, use, or operate a system, piece of equipment etc
man.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: A team of volunteers are manning the phones.
man.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: used to emphasize what you are saying, especially when you are angry, surprised, disappointed etc
man.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: Man, that was a lucky escape!
Oh, man! I can hear the bullets.
man.translation[4].definitions[0].defini: if a person or group mans a vehicle, place, or system, they work there or operate the system
man.translation[4].definitions[0].exampl: He has opened an office manned by two of his sons.
Can you man the phones  (=answer any telephone calls) for an hour?
